events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their car colliding with a tree at an intersection on the morning of May 1st.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident based on the description provided by the customer regarding the vehicle collision.
A claims agent was assigned to the case to manage the investigation and communication with the customer about the car accident.
The claim has been formally acknowledged, and the customer was informed that their auto accident claim is being processed.
The claims agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, the police report, and the customerâ€™s insurance card for further processing.
The customer submitted all requested documents including photos, the police report, and insurance details to facilitate the investigation.
Investigation into the vehicle collision has commenced, including a review of the documents and contacting witnesses to clarify circumstances.
The investigation into the auto accident claim was completed with no discrepancies found in the customer's testimony or documents.
A reasonable settlement amount was proposed to cover the damages to the vehicle based on the assessed repair estimates.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the communication throughout the claim process so far.
The insurance company approved the claim officially, confirming that the settlement amount will be processed for payment.
Payment corresponding to the approved claim settlement has been issued to the customer's bank account successfully.
The auto accident claim was closed after confirmation of payment and receipt of final customer acceptance and feedback.
The claim record was archived in the company's system in accordance with data retention policies following closure.
